Description: Lid sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior: reserved and unslipped on flange; exterior, from centre: incised circle with added red centre and part of rosette with red as filling ornament; two dilute lines; black-figure decoration frieze of lions to right (head, with red ear, part of mane and foreleg of first lion; of second, seated lion, rump and part of tail remaining; red on haunch); at junction of body and rim, two dilute lines; band of triangles on rim and trace of black on edge (mostly lost).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2092) (phase 2)
